page.title: 07THE HELIPORT STATION
page.content: The{equipment}consists of helmets heliographs,mini flares and seacell lamps.The helmets cost Â£400 each,they have 100 helmets which comes to Â£4,0000. Heliographs can signal by reflecting the sunlight.A seacell lamp automatically turns itself on as soon as it touches the water. Their refueling is done by a paraffin bowser which is a fueltanker.Their bowser holds 2.000 gallons.In the{tower.}They take the wind speed in knots from a special dial. They have binoculars for longer vision on helicopter .Also they have ordinance survey maps to take them to helicopter crashes.The Navy has Lynx{helicopters}for use against subs,Wasps for training,Wessex for flying officers and Sharks for display and training.In the hangar they can fit 10 Shark helicopters, 7 Lynx,5 Seakings Mk4&5 or 12 Wasps.
